column4: Hi #ubuntu, my touchpad has apparently stopped working, what should I do?
Was working fine till yesterday and suddenly now it is not working
have you determined if its actually working?
try loading the livecd and see if it works there
It was working fine till yesterday, now I bootup and it is suddenly not working
Yesterday it stopped working then I exec the commands "modprobe -r psmouse" and "modprobe psmouse proto=imps"

i'd start by checking it wasn't physically damaged (ie livecd) just so you don't go down the (frustrating) path of hacking up an xconfig to find its dead. Whilst it sounds like its just intermittant, its to save time long term :)
is it necessasry that I check with LiveCD, how about I test it and see if it is working in Windows?
also works, i don't have windows so livecd was first thought :p
Alright, thanks, let me reboot.
Back. Checked and it is working fine in Windows.
Actually, it works fine until I login, after which it stops working.
It was moving in the login screen but as soon I logged in, it stops..
drop back to console, and install gpm. see if its working in console
oh nvm i'll bet i know what it is
you're using default unity / gnome2? or a kde variant?
default unity
xinput shows it has detected an ALPS DualPoint Touchpad
check your private messages
how?
ops sorry
